definitions.definition: an estimate or a statement of what figures, amounts, or events will be in the future, or what they were in the past, based on what is happening now

examples.text: to make **forward/backward projections** of population figures
Calculations are based on a projection of existing trends.
We have been making forward projections as to future profitability of the firm.
On current projections, there will be more than 13 million people over 65 iin the UK by 2030.
The council has revised its projections of funding requirements upwards.
They presented profit projections for the rest of the year.

definitions.definition: the act of putting an image of something onto a surface; an image that is shown in this way

examples.text: the projection of three-dimensional images on a computer screen

definitions.definition: a solid shape or object as represented on a flat surface
something that sticks out from a surface
the act of making your voice, a sound, etc. audible (= able to be heard) at a distance
the act of imagining that somebody else is thinking the same as you and is reacting in the same way
the act of giving a form and structure to inner thoughts and feelings

examples.text: The idea of God is a projection of humans' need to have something greater than themselves.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in sense (3)): from Latin projectio(n-), from proicere ‘throw forth’, from pro- ‘forth’ + jacere ‘to throw’.
